job_title: Physical Therapy Aide in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Paid time off and patient interaction
cons: Could have better communication and opportunities
Stress and deadlines. Tough subject matter.

pros:
Working at the JAA has many benefits starting with the staff everyone works together from security staff to the CEO to insure patient care is number one.  
Benefit package can not be beat by any organization out there. Health care PTO and incentives are unbeatable.
cons: There are cons to working for the JAA and they start with the Human Resources Dept. employee retention does not seem to be a matter of importance.  Upper management defers promotions, salary and employment to the HR dept. In my 9 years with the JAA I have witnessed HR deny promotion and salary increase when management has (COO, CFO and directors) have rallied only to be shut down.  Again, employee retention does not appear to be of importance.

pros:
The JAA is a wonderful place to work. From the care of the residents to the beautiful campus, it is an excellent work environment. The floors are staffed extremely well. There is a union and unbeatable benefits for the union and non-union staff.

Employees are able to grow and move around within the company. I have personally gotten promoted 2 times from where I started. The JAA is a very loyal and giving company.

It's also conveniently located next to the Waterfront which is great for going out to lunch or doing some shopping after work.
cons: The pay rates sometimes start off on the lower side, as it is a nonprofit. However, raises are given very frequently and the longer you stay, you will be easily making more money.

pros: In my experience, management has been supportive, caring, and invested in our success. My coworkers are a dream to work with, and there's very little drama. Everyone just wants to do the best job possible.
cons: The highest annual merit increase available (3%) is extremely difficult to get, and closer to a cost-of-living raise than a meaningful reward for excellent performance. For many departments there are no real opportunities for advancement or professional development. Agency-wide communication could use a lot of work.

pros: Many, many long-term employees here, that speaks for itself! Great benefits and friendly staff. Positive work environment. Upper Admin holds meetings with ground-level staff to keep everyone informed, and there are many ways to make yourself heard if you have issues or suggestions. Management is willing to listen, and the patients/resident are loved and cared for.
cons: I wish the commute were shorter, but that's my fault for living in the wrong place!

pros: I really can't think of any.
cons:
By far, the worst run facility I've ever been associated with. Managers are self-involved and power-hungry. Many of them lack even the most basic management skills. 
Great Ideology.....Terrible  Execution.

The Human Resources Dept. is rude and condescending. Everyone in the department should be terminated and replaced with professionals who have a true understanding of the role HR is supposed to play in an organization.

The facility is filled with chronic complainers, gossip and negativity.  
Overall, a poor, unhealthy, non-productive work environment.

I would never recommend this company to anyone I cared about!

pros: Great people who have a heart for healthcare!  Excellent benefits!  Been in healthcare for over 30 years at many different organization and this is the one to work for.
cons: Not enough parking spaces for employees at times.

review_title: Loss job due to my neglect I would love to be able to reapply
